title: Russia’s commissioner for children’s rights seeks to portray war crimes accusations as false.
description: An official charged by the International Criminal Court sought to portray her work as a humanitarian project.

title: Days Into Russia’s U.N. Security Council Presidency, Britain Draws a Line
description: Russia had made it clear that a Kremlin official accused of war crimes related to Ukrainian children would be addressing a Council meeting on Ukrainian children.

title: Finland Joins NATO in a Power Shift and Rebuke to Putin
description: The Nordic country became the alliance’s 31st member on Tuesday, spurred by the war in Ukraine, in a strategic setback for President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

title: Russia and Ukraine Use Drones to Bring Death in Battle for Bakhmut
description: Using aerial drones to spot the enemy and direct artillery fire has become a staple of war for Ukraine and Russia, especially in the savage fight for control of Bakhmut.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Trump Charged With 34 Felonies
description: Also, Finland joins NATO and China targets a U.S. chip maker.

title: Evan Gershkovich Covered Repressed Russian Journalists. Now They Are Covering Him.
description: Evan Gershkovich’s work for The Wall Street Journal included reporting on the efforts by Russians to help others who were being repressed. Russian journalists are now scrutinizing his arrest as a brazen attack on press freedom.

title: Avalanche in Indian Himalayas Kills at Least 7 Tourists, Officials Say
description: The authorities said more than 370 people had been rescued. But it remained unclear late Tuesday how many more might be missing.

title: Appeals Court Punts on Due Process Rights for Guantánamo Detainees
description: The case could have resolved an important question about the scope of rights for noncitizens held at the wartime prison.

title: What Is NATO and Which Countries Are Members?
description: This Western mutual-defense alliance, which recently said it would increase the number of troops on standby, is central to the war in Ukraine, even though Ukraine is not a member.

title: What We Know About the Bomb Attack on a Russian Pro-War Blogger
description: The killing of Vladlen Tatarsky came at a volatile moment in Russia, and could herald a further crackdown on dissent. Here’s how the case has developed so far.

title: Donald Trump Prepares to Surrender
description: The Manhattan indictments may not even present his biggest legal threat.

title: Finland Deals a Blow to Putin as It Enters NATO
description: The Nordic country will become NATO’s 31st member on Tuesday, expanding the alliance in a strategic setback for President Vladimir Putin of Russia.

title: Surrogacy Emerges as the Wedge Issue for Italy’s Hard Right
description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has ordered municipalities to stop certifying foreign birth certificates for same-sex couples who used surrogacy, leaving some babies in a legal limbo.

title: George Soros Is a Familiar Villain for the Right Wing in Trump’s Indictment
description: Conspiracy theorists have long attributed wildly varied events to George Soros, in attacks often viewed as antisemitic. His indirect donations to a prosecutor’s campaign are animating Trump allies.

title: Train Derails in the Netherlands, Killing at Least One
description: The passenger train, which was on its way to The Hague, struck a crane early Tuesday morning, officials said. Dozens were hurt.

title: As Temperatures Rise, Melbourne’s Bats Get Their Own Sprinkler System
description: On the hottest days, a refreshing mist will cool down flying foxes, which have suffered mass death in Australian heat waves.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Fallout from a bombing in Russia.

title: Nigel Lawson, Economic Force Under Thatcher, Dies at 91
description: As chancellor of the Exchequer, he helped lift Britain with tax cuts and other Conservative measures — the “Lawson Boom” — but harder times followed, and he resigned.
